website_summaries.verdict: We love the soft cord design, which is easy on the hands, but the lack of handle means it's not suitable for all uses.
pros: An extremely durable training leash with strong hardware
cons: Some users would prefer a handle

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight Rope for 8 week pups
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for yard training for pups. Lightweight but very stong and didn't fray. If they are headed into road i just step on the end without having run after them. Plus if they are around the corner I can easily know their whereabouts by looking for the end of the leads. Sometimes they get caught around a tree or our swing but easy to undo. Highly recommend and money well spent. Yes you can get a rope burn if they are high-speed running while holding it but easily preventable with common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Alligator

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service by SportDog!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this at the beginning of April and used it every day for 3 months, training my English Springer Spaniel puppy. It was light enough for her to easily drag around, doesn't tangle easily and is easy to clean if hauled through mud. I had a problem with the brass clasp, emailed a polite inquiry to SportDog and received an immediate response. They sent me a new check cord along with a prepaid return label to send the old one back. Great customer service by SportDog.
customer_reviews.author: janis

customer_reviews.title: Nice swimming line
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use when my dog goes swimming. He loves to swim but won't stop unless we can pull him out. We attach this to his harness and he has a ball. It doesn't tangle, doesn't soak up water, dries fast and even floats. I could have used a loop on the end but I've just tied a knot to give myself something to hold on to and that works OK.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald R. Kinner

customer_reviews.title: and this one just works better. It doesn't tend to get tangled
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it is just a piece of rope with a snap on the end. However, we have used many others, including the metal wire ones, and this one just works better. It doesn't tend to get tangled, and it doesn't get hard bends in it like the metal wires. The first one we purchased has been in use for many years, and although it faded from orange to white, it is still going strong. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as billed
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have read the description that there is no handle on the end. While I realize this leash is for recall training, not walking, it's still nice to have something to loop around your hand if the dog takes off. Also, our dog chewed through it on the first use, in about fifteen seconds when my back was turned. Now we have a really expensive orange rope with a frayed end. Might be a good product for a dog who doesn't have a lightening speed razor chew. The orange color is great, easy to keep track of the line and not trip. Bummed we can't use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Cahumiko

customer_reviews.title: Nothing Fancy, Just a Bright Long Line
customer_reviews.text: This long line is just that, a long line. Nothing fancy, nothing amazing. What I like about this long line is the bright color which makes it easy to identify my dog, and the diameter of the cord which is just right for holding in your hand. My cord does get tangled plenty though when I clip it on my dog so I question the "tangle-free" marketing. I usually have to spend 10 or 15 minutes untangling after using it on my dog. I also felt they could have at least burned the end of the cord or somehow sealed it so it's not just a chopped piece of cord at the tail end.
customer_reviews.author: mjk8a

customer_reviews.title: A good solid long line for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, nothing bad to say here. I bought this long line for tracking and recall work, plus, for client dogs. This is a good line, it washes easily and it doesn't tangle up, plus, it doesn't cut into my hands if my dog decides to pull. It picks up forrrest debris, but that is to be expected from anything but a biothane long line. I like this one, and have sent a few clients to buy this one as well.
customer_reviews.author: RachelTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful option for water play!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Not too heavy for my 40 lb Springer mix, floats easily, and pretty light for me to carry around! It doesn’t have a loop at the end so I just tied a couple knots to give me something to hold onto if needed. Works great to give my dog some room to play in public lakes without having to take him off leash!
customer_reviews.author: Shanley Roach

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy.  Finished well-no strings hanging.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. My dog bolts. We also have a swimming hole at which he socializes. I bought this for running "free" in fields and swimming "free" in the river BUT when he starts to bolt, I can just step on the rope and prevent it! And yes, this really DOES float! The bright orange color is VERY helpful for me (so I can see where to step when he starts to bolt) and also for those around who won't trip on that as it's dragging.
customer_reviews.author: Any Mouse

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality and practical
customer_reviews.text: SportDOG seems to make a good product. I've owned a couple of their dummy's as well and they all hold up well and are of good quality. This leash is exactly what I would have expected from them. I use it multiple times a week training with my pup. When it gets overly muddy or dirty (we are in the mud quite a bit), I just wash it with the hose and let it air dry. I'd definitely buy it again. Couldn't hurt to have the 50' cord either (if your on the fence).
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but magically comes off the collar
customer_reviews.text: The leash is sturdy, it does float; however, on about 6 occasions my dog suddenly was leashless. The locking mechanism would open on its own and come off. To me, this defeats the purpose, if I wanted my dog off leash, I would let her off leash. It opens and closes normally, so there is no reason why it should be coming off on its own. I ended up buying a climbing rope that has a locking carabiner instead, much happier and feeling much more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie T

customer_reviews.title: Best long line I've ever used with dogs
customer_reviews.text: I am working to socialize an extremely fearful feral dog and found this long line to be much better than anything I've used in the past. It hardly ever gets hung up except when the dog wraps completely around a tree or post. The dog is much easier to gather up after releasing since I don't have to enter his space and can walk away from him to pick up the lead and then gather up the slack in a controlled manner. The only thing I am adding to the check cord is reflective/luminous tape in 1 foot increments from the end of the cord so it's easier to work with him in low light conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: Great For Paddle Boarding Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I like to take my dog paddle boarding with me, but she likes to jump in and swim and gets distracted by ducks and other people. Great for water holes that you don't have all to yourself. It is very nice to have a floating 30' leash to keep her contained but still have enough freedom to play. The floating rope helps it not get tangled in the feet keeping my dog safe. Also great for playing fetch in the water from the shore. Again, giving me the ability to keep her from getting distracted and swimming off and bothering other people. My goldendoodle is very social and loves the water. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, sturdy check cord!
customer_reviews.text: Great check cord! Solid clasp and sturdy rope. Have been using this daily for 4 months with no signs of fraying. Update: First cord lasted exactly 528 days. The cord shows very little signs of fraying but unfortunately the clasp broke. I ordered a replacement and will be buying a spare clasp to re-work the old one as a backup. Seriously happy with this considering its been in freshwater/saltwater/dragged through mud, brush, across pavement, etc. Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good for recall training but could use a handle
customer_reviews.text: Nice bright color that let me practice "come" with my 4 mo puppy, and to let him run around in off leash areas like beaches without worrying if he'll run off. The only thing I wish this had was a handle, since the end is just literally the end of the rope. It wasn't a huge deal though - I just use a rock climbing knot to make the end into a loop.
customer_reviews.author: vh7

customer_reviews.title: a must have for you Dog
customer_reviews.text: Well read some of the reviews before i purchased. All naysayers on leash should give this leash another try?? This leash does everything right. It floats, it does not knot around bushes and rocks and ankles. The Lead has a sturdy feel to it in hand. The brass clip is sturdy enough for my 85lb motivated Lab. So lets see how this lead drys out and holds up in a month or so when i update my review later..
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this leash he is free to roam around but still safely under my control, I use it all the time. He doesn’t pull, those retractable leashes teach you dog to pull, terrible idea. My dog is very strong but doesn’t pull at all, people are surprised.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: but helps with visibility even as it gets dirty.
customer_reviews.text: Very long, very bright, stronger than expected. There is no handle loop on the end, which at first threw me off. However, in practice I ended up using this very differently than a normal leash. I'd let rope out so my dog could fetch, then sort of reel him in, looping up the rope as he returned. That bright orange won't be bright for very long, but helps with visibility even as it gets dirty.
customer_reviews.author: CarlTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good Rope Lead
customer_reviews.text: A good product. The rope does not tangle easily and is easy to form into a loop for rolling . The brass clip is well made. It is strong and heavy and was the primary reason I purchased this rope lead. I had read other product reviews in which the clip was weak, easily broke, and even cut hands. This is a good durable product which I expect to last a long time. The bright orange color makes it easy to see and the rope handles well.
customer_reviews.author: Alien

customer_reviews.title: Good lead. Brass tarnishes very quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help train our pup for off leash work. He’s getting used to it now(4 months old) but it was a bit heavy for him before. This thing gets dragged through all kinds of mud and grime and cleans up very easily. One critique would be the brass clasp. Within days of use it changed from shiny brass to a dull color. At first we thought it was rust but it seems the finish wore off. Still functions normally, we were just surprised how fast it looked worn out. Literally after 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: The good and the bad
customer_reviews.text: I give this lead 3/5 stars. Pros: Bright color Doesn’t get tangled Thick cord Cons: No handle to wrap around your hand No visibility at night The collar latch looks like it is made cheaply Overall this is way better than the flat 50ft leash i had prior. The flat would get tangled very easily. I just wish this one had a handle so i can wrap it around my wrist while training in busy areas.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Smith

customer_reviews.title: He's also not very good off leash yet
customer_reviews.text: We brought this to the beach with our King Charles Cavalier Spaniel puppy. I was worried that if he ran out into the ocean, he'd be swept away! He's also not very good off leash yet, and will run off to things that look interesting. This leash worked great. He wasn't very interested in the ocean, but it was still very useful when it came to playing fetch!
customer_reviews.author: Attack HamsterTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not a brass clip
customer_reviews.text: One reason I purchased this one was the brass clip they advertised and showed in the pictures so corrosion would not be an issue. What I got is a cheap plated clip. Debating returning it. It just isn't worth it if it isn't the quality advertised. The rope weave is quite loose also and will snag easily in briers.
customer_reviews.author: B. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: ... while walking through the woods and it’s bright and easy to find the dog
customer_reviews.text: Used this a few times while walking through the woods and it’s bright and easy to find the dog. Only use it with our puppy and it helps catch him.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as you would like
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had this check cord for almost two years and just recently the snap broke. I had noticed it had been getting stiff and rusty over the last few months too. I’m a little disappointed considering this should hold up better than most leashes for outdoors type of stuff but it didn’t. I have another leash that I bought from another company prior and it has been through and back with no signs of wearing down. I will buy from them from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great long leash that floats!
customer_reviews.text: Love this leash! I use it on my kayak to hook my dog to (who wears a life jacket). The leash floats and I don't have to worry about her swimming off. I've also used it as just a long lead to let her run around at our cabin. It doesn't get caught on too many things- is super bright and easy to see. And it's very long!
customer_reviews.author: Soccere3

customer_reviews.title: So good I got a second one
customer_reviews.text: I’m lazy and don’t always want to take my dog to the bark park so I got this. Then I got a second dog to reduce how much I have to play with my dog. Then I got a second leash because I’m lazy and didn’t want to always take two dogs to the park. Leash so good, keeps lazy people lazy
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Gets dirty, hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: It IS lightweight, but it gets very dirty, very easily and it is not easy to clean. I soaked it in the tub and left out to dry overnight but it did not dry and the dirt did not come off. I am going to return and pay more for a biothane long line which might be heavier but will be easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: T.L.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Taken a LOT of abuse and still no wear!
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help with recall/off leash training my new rescue pup, a 12 month old 110lb Dane/Hound/Pointer mix.. Since June it has been in and out of water, creeks, dragged around fields, brush, rocks, dirt roads and more .. taken a lot of daily abuse and still no wear. I really like that it's made of real "rope" and not the scratchy plastic/polyester type that can wreak havoc on your hands.. this is very comfortable and soft, yet strong. I tied a knot in the end to create a "handle". The closure is quality hardware, very secure and made to last. And it washes up great, just stuck it in the sink with some dish soap, cleaned up great.
customer_reviews.author: AWyld

customer_reviews.title: Good Lead Cord
customer_reviews.text: This cord is sturdy, does not tangle, and is light weight. We hook it to our large puppy and use it to give him some freedom while preventing him from going where he shouldn't in an unfenced area. Has been dragged through some inclement conditions and is holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but gets stiff after getting wet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use for a tracking dog. Found that it absorbed water and mud and got very stiff. I wound up with rope burns trying to hold on to my 50 lb dog on a track. It also loses its brightness once it's used in the field a few times.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: It is a training rope, tie your own handle loops
customer_reviews.text: Great tie up lead. This would make a good call back training lead for a normal dog. It is a rope with clasp on one end. No preformed handle. I tied 2 handle loops but my 100 lb Rottweiler is all muscle & goes from 0 to 100% in a mS. Being a synthetic rope it has some surface slip. This resulted in unpleasant rope burns when she bolted. Work gloves would & did solve that issue. High visibility orange helps locate the rope & of course the rope is suited for water as it floats. Priced right.
customer_reviews.author: Dara Morrison

customer_reviews.title: If your pup is a camper or backpacker BUY THIS NOW!
customer_reviews.text: This was absolutely clutch when we backpacked the CDT 1109 trail. My pup is 83lbs and this did really well when squirrels ran by and he tried taking off after them. I tied a handle at the end which made it easier to carabiner to trees and I even made it into a belt so he could wander ahead of me hands free. The length is great and the bright color makes it easy to find at dusk. This is now an essential in my pups pack.
customer_reviews.author: Alison Sipos

customer_reviews.title: Fine lease without a handle
customer_reviews.text: This leash is fine. It is not heavy and is well constructed. My only complaint is that it does not have a loop on the end opposite of the leash hook. The lack of a loop or handle at one end makes this lease difficult to implement. Overall, I recommend it because a loop can easily be tied at the end of the lease.
customer_reviews.author: Jarred

customer_reviews.title: Great for Overly Friendly Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes to play in our front yard, but can't help running out to people everytime they walk by our home. It sometimes freaks them out (understandably), especially if she runs up to children. So, I use this to tie around a tree in the front to let her play and hang out without having to worry. She hasn't bitten through this (which is very surprising) so that is a plus in my book!
customer_reviews.author: Suelin Kwon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for teaching a recall while not having the dog off leash.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Low tech lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to keep my puppy safe on our unfenced property right on a highway. If she starts to bolt, just step on the cord. Much cheaper and less restrictive than a heavy e collar. This is totally hands free as well, unlike the ecollar where you have to have the remote in hand.
customer_reviews.author: sleepyhead

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light.
customer_reviews.text: using this for my GSP puppy currently 10 weeks old. Holding up good with 2 weeks field play. Light rope that doesn't get heavy when wet, doesn't stretch wet or dry.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: easy release & wind up cord to allow your dog to walk or run next to you
customer_reviews.text: Flat coated retriever runs in the park chasing everything this allows me to let her run and get some exercise for myself! Very easily to wind up and let go the line from your wrist-hand. . My wife and kids love using it too.
customer_reviews.author: jstsurfn

customer_reviews.title: Works well and very durable.
customer_reviews.text: So much nicer than flat line, wish had loop on end for holding but just tied on in. Been using every day ...no wear on it. Gsd doesnt chew on it like flat line. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for running the dogs in the field and training.
customer_reviews.author: crystalpumpkinpup

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This check cord is light weight, smooth to the touch and functions well. It is not too heavy, so when my golden retriever was 5 months and smaller, it wasn’t too heavy and now that she is bigger it is still great... even my dog trainer extraordinaire loves this cord and wanted one for himself
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Laura J. Bartner

customer_reviews.title: allows me to always have control of my pup, while she runs like she's free
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday with my gsd puppy. it allows her to run 'free' while I'm still able to control at a moment's notice if people or other dogs approach. this leash has only caught on tables and chairs, when used in woods or fields she has never gotten stuck on branches.
customer_reviews.author: USA traveler

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: This is great!!! We use it for our dog often when outdoors. She doesn’t really venture too far away from us but it is nice to have the connection incase she won’t listen to come back. It floats in water. We used it canoeing too let her swim. Gives her a lot of freedom but keeps her safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda V

customer_reviews.title: Great Leash for the Price
customer_reviews.text: We use this leash with our 10 lb puppy so he can run on the beach - we can't trust him off leash yet. It is great quality for the price and not too heavy for him to drag around! The bright orange color for visbility is also very helpful. Take a velcro strip ot something similar for easy wrap-up and storage.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Mogavero

customer_reviews.title: Stronger than your belt
customer_reviews.text: This cord is strong, lightweight, and relatively tangle-resistant. Our dog loves to run, but isn't trained well enough to be off leash yet, so a long lead is really helpful. The belt to which I used to tie this cord gets fewer stars (see pic) - it was no match for 50 lb of full-sprinting Kelpie, but this cord (and a Ruffwear Front Range harness and the pooch herself) held up just fine when she took off after another dog.
customer_reviews.author: Ned Gladstone

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy leash
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I used it for my puppy when we went on beach vacation. Puppy can run freely but can be easily stop if needed. It doesn’t tangle easily, very light weight even if soaked in water and covered in sand also it dries very quick.
customer_reviews.author: Black Diamond

customer_reviews.title: just choose this one, it's a thick cord rather than a flat leash
customer_reviews.text: My little toy fox terrier loves to explore. Sometimes he wanders a little far off. This bright orange cable kinda feels like a rock climbing rig -- it's a little bungie but not too much, really durable, and not at all too heavy for my 11 lb dog. My other bigger dog can't bite through it (yet, anyway).
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to start off lead training
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for beginner high distraction training. I’m using mine for scent tracking training. I’ve since moved to a 100’ check cord but still use the 30’ for basic mind training which wears the dog out more than any physical training will do.
customer_reviews.author: chad crawley

customer_reviews.title: Great for training a retriever.
customer_reviews.text: This is a strong, light leash. It is fairly stiff, so it will resist knots and tangles. It is also less likely to get wrapped around bushes and other obstructions if your dog takes a detour during a training session.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Vomela

customer_reviews.title: Never tangles
customer_reviews.text: Use this as a tie out for my pit bull. Been using the same one for almost 3 yrs. Never tangles but in wet and cold winter it gets stiff. Faded a little but no fraying. Ordered a second one in case it wears out.I reinforced ends with nylon cable ties.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lohff

customer_reviews.title: Perfect training tool
customer_reviews.text: Quality check line. Good grip when I step on it. Reviews criticizing the buckle or saying their dog chewed the line are just ridiculous. This is a check line not a leash. A heavy buckle just calls the dog's attention to it. It's also not a tie out. Don't allow your dog to chew it. If you don't understand the concept, hire a trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Eric H

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy, long leash
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 4 months ago for my new pup, works great! I use it when we go on hikes or in wooded parks where I want to keep her on leash, but give her more room to roam. No tears, frays, or breaks at all, doesn't get all tangled, and coils up nicely. It gets dirty pretty quick, so doesn't stay bright orange for long - but most of the dirt washes out with a quick hose down. Definitely use it with a harness and not a neck collar.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Smith

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Durable!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to help train my puppy at the parks. Works really well. Now my puppy is 13 months and we use it for water training. It's highly visible and floats on the water perfectly. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Floats and is easy to grab
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's taking a beating and holding up well. Floats and is easy to grab. It won't tear up your hands if you continually spool it as the distance between you and your dog changes frequently in more populated areas (that's what I do until we get out to the trails). Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Smephrob

customer_reviews.title: Lacking durability
customer_reviews.text: Well, the clip broke on one within days. The plastic holding the spring broke. Probably not worth returning. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: Rope Burn
customer_reviews.text: I love the color but I shouldn't have gone with a cord. aaahhhh, the rope burn. The other thing too, the clip isn't small. It's a standard medium clip.
customer_reviews.author: Joe A

customer_reviews.title: Clasp can get stuck
customer_reviews.text: This rope is really light, strong and easy to carry. I was trying to use it on the beach and the clasp must have gotten sand in it. It kept getting stuck. I love the rope though. I can't use it on the beach unless I get another clasp.
customer_reviews.author: Drew N. Goodrich

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Doesn't Tangle
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, doesn't tangle, doesn't get stiff. I really like this for my German Shepherd, I can now let him range a little farther than before while we are in training.
customer_reviews.author: p8nthorse

customer_reviews.title: Clip got stuck
customer_reviews.text: The clip got stuck in the open position for the longest time. It closed eventually, but now I'm hesitant to use it knowing it can malfunction.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon C

customer_reviews.title: Lead does not tangle
customer_reviews.text: Love this floating lead! My young Chessie would get a wild hair occasionally and take off when she was supposed to retrieve a training dummy out of the pond. This lead ended that game she was playing. If she tries to take off, I just step on the lead as she is getting out of the pond. I don’t have any problems with this lead tangling or wrapping around anything while she is swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's long enough that he can swim and/or walk far away and explore while we still have a good grip on him
customer_reviews.text: We bought this leash for taking our dog canoeing since we don't trust his recall and wanted to make sure he stayed with us. It's long enough that he can swim and/or walk far away and explore while we still have a good grip on him. I especially liked that the rope floats so it's easy to see and won't get tangled in his (or our) legs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Resists Tangling
customer_reviews.text: This is the only long lead I have tried that does not tangle, is easily released and regathered during dog training, and endures weather and overly enthusiastic large dogs.
customer_reviews.author: A.W.

customer_reviews.title: Good thick check cord, good on hands
customer_reviews.text: Good thick training rope, much more durable than standard 1/4" poly rope. Tangles less than flat cords I have.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it for the water, but I call it the “training rope” and when we pull it out our dog goes into the mindset he’s in training mode. Love the bright orange and it being so light weight. I did knot the end easy to grab when needed
customer_reviews.author: michelle l olson

customer_reviews.title: Very great quality! Perfect for training
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for training with my golden retriever. Love how bright colored it is. Sturdy. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Lwheels

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but the latch broke shortly after first use
customer_reviews.text: The little bob to open the part to hook on a collar broke off in a months time... we use our fingernail to open in order to latch to collar now. Had a previous one that lasted until a puppy chewed through it. Otherwise does the job.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: tangles easily
customer_reviews.text: Gets tangled easily when using in the woods. I should have opted for an all leather check cord
customer_reviews.author: DENISE MCDONALD

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This harness appears to be made much cheaper than I originally thought. It causes bad rope burn on my hands and had nothing to hold on to at the end.
customer_reviews.author: LisaMarie

customer_reviews.title: Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Not the same color or quality as the leash in the photo. I could have just bought a rope and put a latch on it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Marie Riley

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Just what I needed to work with my border collie. It gives him more leeway but still knows to obey. :) Great for training.
customer_reviews.author: sherry C.

customer_reviews.title: Love this lead!
customer_reviews.text: Love this leash for when we go to the lake. It floats, you can see it, and it dries off quickly. So far it is holding up very well. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen D. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought for training my plott hound to track pheasant. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gets dirty very quickly
customer_reviews.text: Gets dirty very quickly. Needs a handle on the end of the rope. Does a good job of training my dog. I do not like having to tie a handle on each time i use it
customer_reviews.author: mickey

customer_reviews.title: A great swimming lead
customer_reviews.text: Great to use for dog to swim when they have to be on a lease! Floats and nice length.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Finally the perfect leash..
customer_reviews.text: It is bright, lightweight, my little yorkie mix loves it because it moves with him. As for not having a handle... not a problem... one end has a knot and the rope is already sealed. A couple of zip ties and vavoom!! custom sizing !!! I don't know if it is truly going to last a lifetime, but if it doesn't, I will certainly buy this cord before any other kind.. bravo!! nice when someone gets it RIGHT....
customer_reviews.author: Birdie reviews

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot heavier and thicker than I wanted. I am sure it will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: judith leclerc

customer_reviews.title: Nice long line..
customer_reviews.text: Great for recall training..cleans easily..good hardware on it..Paracord beats flat cotton..
customer_reviews.author: DaveOviedo

customer_reviews.title: Good training leash
customer_reviews.text: Used for dog going in pond. Dog chewed on end where snap is and only taped. Need to retake. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to claims.
customer_reviews.text: Use as tie-out for our dog. Does NOT tangle or kink like coated wire ones. Easily visible. Don't have to worry about running over with lawn mower. Haven't used in water yet but assume will float as other claims are spot on.
customer_reviews.author: jman

customer_reviews.title: I should have known better!
customer_reviews.text: A nylon rope with a clasp. No handle. I could have made the same thing for under $8.
customer_reviews.author: myoldog

customer_reviews.title: No handle!
customer_reviews.text: A check cord has no handle. Oops. It will still do the job when we go to the park though!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great long leash. Nice and bright coloring. Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie C.

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Perfect for my 20 lb terrier
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Perfect for my 20 lb terrier. Gives him a bit more freedom and good way to practice recall. Good length too- if too long i cab see how managing the length would be cumbersome, but it's not. It's also quite light, which is good for my little dog.
customer_reviews.author: ESCAPE

customer_reviews.title: Durablility & Visibility ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.text: Our rottweiler loves to go on hikes and loves romping in the water. Though I used a lead when we went swimming, I was concerned for his safety because in lake water easily discernable. I purchased the SportDog Orange Check Cord and was impressed by it's durability, the fact that the color didn't fade, and that it is strong enough for a 127# dog. I highly recommend the SportDog Orange Check Cord.
customer_reviews.author: KReed

customer_reviews.title: works but clip is not super durable
customer_reviews.text: works well but the clip is less durable than my other long lead so I can’t use this one on my reactive dog for fear that it may unclasp if she runs full throttle at a dog. i use it on my more low maintenance dog
customer_reviews.author: nicole polsinelli

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, doesn't tangle, highly visible, does not get weighted down by dirt, water, and mud like other flat woven leads. High quality!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: EyeLoveGlassesTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Used these looped their life vests at the beach. They float so they don’t get tangled in their feet and you can clearly see them. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product:strong, light and efficient!!! Goats very happy!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cords for our goats!!! The best we had!!! Light, easy to sea, they don't tangle anymore!! Very happy with it and they look perfect despite using them daily!!!
customer_reviews.author: P. Rosenthal

customer_reviews.title: The clasp broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take my dog to the beach (since it is advertised as a floating leash) and the clasp broke on first use and the line is now unusable. It did seem to float but the cord became heavy when wet and didn't work as a trailing line for my dog to run around with. This was overall a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Scharping

customer_reviews.title: Great lake leashes!
customer_reviews.text: Really does float! Great of taking the pups to the lake but not ready to be off leash just yet!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Got this in 2017, reporting in from 2020.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this every day to take my dog out since I got it in 2017. I was just thinking as it went through the umpteenth briar patch that it's held up extremely well. Basically perceptible no fraying even though it's been dragging along the ground and seriously neglected and abused by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: What a steal!
customer_reviews.text: I love this line so much. It's super sturdy, easy on the hands, a great width, and easy to keep track of. Definitely a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hayward

customer_reviews.title: It's a check cord....
customer_reviews.text: Well so far it has done everything I've asked of it.....keep the dog from running away. Better price than its competitors and my dog heels well after many sessions.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey N Blaine

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Rope and clip appear to be high quality, and price is very nice for what you get. They have held up very well for almost a year now. It's still bright orange and the clip shows no signs of rust or damage.
customer_reviews.author: Mack Trust

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We have an 8 week old Vizsla and this lead was perfect! Not too heavy and gave us the peace of mind when she was running in the backyard that we would be able to catch her. We will then use it to teach recall and later add the sport dog e-collar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Water Outings!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great lead for the water. Used it this week when I took my pup to the ocean. The color makes it easy to see. It floats which keeps it easy to reach and limits the tangles. The length allowed my dog to have a great deal of fun, without my fear of her swimming too far out. Loved it so much. My friend is now ordering one for her fur baby.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine D.

customer_reviews.title: Great training tool
customer_reviews.text: Good durable cord for outdoor training. I like the color as it's easy to see in the grass.
customer_reviews.author: PGS

customer_reviews.title: BIG
customer_reviews.text: Kinda overwhelming. Thick rope. Just lots of material. Definitely for bigger dogs.
customer_reviews.author: littljeane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for training
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for training and used it for my corgi's water adventures in creeks and streams. I do occasionally use it to walk in large parks where my corgi can run freely while I can still have control. Only downside is it is rough on the hands and have had rope burn several times. Definitely stick to trainings.
customer_reviews.author: Kim NY

product_meta.title: SportDOG Orange Check Cord
product_meta.description: Color:OrangeLightweight and easy to coil and carry, this orange cord is easier to find.
feature_bullets: This 30 foot check cord is great for exercising and training dogs and is made with lightweight but strong material; Meant for training, it does not feature a handle for leash walking
It will float when submerged and is highly visible against any background with its blaze orange color
The rope is designed to easily coil when you are ready to put it away and to not tangle or catch on brush while attached to your dog
The clip is small and durable, made with heavy-duty brass, giving you confident control during training sessions
Locally based Customer Care Center, available 6 days a week, provides support when you need it

By designing our products in the field, with heat, cold, rain, snow, dust, mud, and wind in mind, SportDOG has become the most recognized brand in the electronic tracking and training categories, making the promise to always create "Gear The Way You'd Design It"

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
